snippet: Fierce street battles and high civilian casualties were reported in the fight between rebels and forces loyal to the exiled president.
abstract: Houthi fighters enter Aden, Yemen, pushing against resistance by forces loyal to exiled Pres Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi; Houthi victory in city, second largest in country, would deal significant setback to Saudi-led coalition fighting Houthis.

byline.original: By SAEED AL-BATATI and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Saeed Al-Batati reported from Al Mukalla, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Mohammad Ali Kalfood contributed reporting from Sana, Yemen.

lead_paragraph: Fierce street battles and high civilian casualties were reported in the fight between rebels and forces loyal to the exiled president.

headline.main: Rebels in Yemen Battle for Control of Strategic Port City
headline.print_headline: Rebels in Yemen Battle for Control of Strategic Port City
